Description: Mould made pottery lamp. Applied vertical band-handle. Discus decorated with a band of ring-and-dot patterns; discus-rim in form of branch pattern. Shoulder shows, between bands of ring-and-dot patterns and of raised points, a Greek inscription. Nozzle-top decorated with a cross. Undefined base. Pink clay with mica covered with red slip. The front part is blackened. X-group and Early Christian.
Curator's comments: Same Series: Liverpool AAA xiv, 1927, pl. lviii, 6, from Faras, Western Cemetery 6, Grave 8; Monneret de Villard, U., 1957. ‘La Nubia Médioévale’ iii. Cairo : Imprimerie de l'Institut français d'archéologie orientale, Appendice, p.18, 1; Provoost, A., 1983. ‘De materiële cultuur van de eerste Christenen’. Leuven : Faculteit Letteren en Wijsbegerte K. U. Leuven : Uitgeverij Ac, p. 255, 14, 19, from Faras. Very close: Forrer, R., 1893. ‘Die frühchristlichen Alterthümer aus dem Gräberfelde von Achmim-Panopolis’. Strassburg : F. Lohbauer, pl. V, 4, from Akhmim/Panopolis. Bibl. Liverpool AAA xiv, 1927, p. 73.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2222)
